1.text: “Behold, my eye has seen all this. My ear has heard and understood it.

2.text: What you know, I know also. I am not inferior to you.

3.text: “Surely I would speak to the Almighty. I desire to reason with God.

4.text: But you are forgers of lies. You are all physicians of no value.

5.text: Oh that you would be completely silent! Then you would be wise.

6.text: Hear now my reasoning. Listen to the pleadings of my lips.

7.text: Will you speak unrighteously for God, and talk deceitfully for him?

8.text: Will you show partiality to him? Will you contend for God?

9.text: Is it good that he should search you out? Or as one deceives a man, will you deceive him?

10.text: He will surely reprove you if you secretly show partiality.

11.text: Shall not his majesty make you afraid, And his dread fall on you?

12.text: Your memorable sayings are proverbs of ashes, Your defenses are defenses of clay.

13.text: “Be silent, leave me alone, that I may speak. Let come on me what will.

14.text: Why should I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in my hand?

15.text: Behold, he will kill me. I have no hope. Nevertheless, I will maintain my ways before him.

16.text: This also shall be my salvation, that a godless man shall not come before him.

17.text: Hear diligently my speech. Let my declaration be in your ears.

18.text: See now, I have set my cause in order. I know that I am righteous.

19.text: Who is he who will contend with me? For then would I hold my peace and give up the spirit.

20.text: “Only don’t do two things to me; then I will not hide myself from your face:

21.text: withdraw your hand far from me; and don’t let your terror make me afraid.

22.text: Then call, and I will answer; or let me speak, and you answer me.

23.text: How many are my iniquities and sins? Make me know my disobedience and my sin.

24.text: Why hide you your face, and hold me for your enemy?

25.text: Will you harass a driven leaf? Will you pursue the dry stubble?

26.text: For you write bitter things against me, and make me inherit the iniquities of my youth:

27.text: You also put my feet in the stocks, and mark all my paths. You set a bound to the soles of my feet,

28.text: though I am decaying like a rotten thing, like a garment that is moth-eaten.
